docs.title: Gohan - Hyprland Environment Manager
docs.text:
Welcome to Gohan documentation! Gohan is a comprehensive tool for managing your Hyprland desktop environment with automated installation, beautiful theming, and seamless configuration management.

What is Gohan?

Gohan is your all-in-one Hyprland environment manager that brings beautiful themes, automated installation, and powerful configuration management to your fingertips.

docs.title: 🚀 Quick Start
docs.text:
Install and run Gohan
# Install Gohan
git clone https://github.com/rebelopsio/gohan.git
cd gohan
go build -o gohan ./cmd/gohan

# Apply a theme
./gohan theme set latte

# List available themes
./gohan theme list

docs.title: 🎯 Use Cases
docs.text:
New UsersTheme EnthusiastsPower Users

Complete Setup

Get started with Hyprland in minutes with our automated installer.

# Complete Hyprland setup in one command
gohan install hyprland-complete

# Apply your favorite theme
gohan theme set mocha

Theme Management

Browse, preview, and apply themes with instant hot-reload.

# Browse themes
gohan theme list

# Preview before applying
gohan theme preview latte

# Apply and auto-reload
gohan theme set latte

# Rollback if you change your mind
gohan theme rollback

Advanced Features

Customize everything with templates and manage your configuration history.

# Custom configurations with templates
gohan config deploy --template custom.tmpl

# View installation history
gohan history list

# Rollback installations
gohan config rollback <backup-id>

docs.title: Key Patterns

1. Dependency Injection: Using container pattern

docs.title: BDD → ATDD → TDD
docs.text:
Gohan uses a strict Behavior-Driven Development workflow:

1. Write Gherkin Feature (BDD)
   ↓
2. Write Acceptance Tests (ATDD)
   ↓
3. Write Unit Tests (TDD - RED)
   ↓
4. Implement Code (GREEN)
   ↓
5. Refactor (Keep tests GREEN)

docs.title: Example: Adding a New Feature
docs.text: Let's add a "theme export" feature:

docs.title: Step 1: Write BDD Feature
docs.text:
Create docs/features/theme-export.feature: 

Feature: Theme Export
  As a user
  I want to export my current theme
  So that I can share it with others

  Scenario: Export active theme
    Given the active theme is "mocha"
    When I export the theme
    Then I should receive a JSON file
    And the file should contain theme colors

docs.title: Step 2: Write Acceptance Test
docs.text:
Create tests/acceptance/theme_export_test.go: 

func TestThemeExport_ExportActiveTheme(t *testing.T) {
    t.Run("exports active theme to JSON", func(t *testing.T) {
        ctx := context.Background()

        // Given
        registry := theme.NewThemeRegistry()
        err := theme.InitializeStandardThemes(registry)
        require.NoError(t, err)

        // When
        useCase := theme.NewExportThemeUseCase(registry)
        result, err := useCase.Execute(ctx)

        // Then
        require.NoError(t, err)
        assert.NotEmpty(t, result.JSON)
        assert.Contains(t, result.JSON, "mocha")
    })
}

docs.title: Step 3: Write Unit Tests
docs.text:
Create internal/application/theme/export_theme_test.go: 

func TestExportThemeUseCase_Execute(t *testing.T) {
    tests := []struct {
        name        string
        activeTheme string
        wantErr     bool
    }{
        {
            name:        "export mocha theme",
            activeTheme: "mocha",
            wantErr:     false,
        },
    }

    for _, tt := range tests {
        t.Run(tt.name, func(t *testing.T) {
            // Test implementation
        })
    }
}

docs.text:
Create internal/application/theme/export_theme.go: 

type ExportThemeUseCase struct {

}

func (uc *ExportThemeUseCase) Execute(ctx context.Context) (*ExportResult, error) {
    // Implementation
}

docs.title: Step 5: Add CLI Command
docs.text:
Update internal/cli/cmd/theme.go: 

var themeExportCmd = &cobra.Command{
    Use:   "export",
    Short: "Export current theme",
    RunE:  runThemeExport,

docs.title: Installation Guide
docs.text: This guide will walk you through installing Gohan and setting up your Hyprland environment.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text:
System Requirements

  • OS: Linux (Debian/Ubuntu-based distributions recommended)
  • Architecture: x86_64 or ARM64
  • Go: Version 1.21 or higher (for building from source)
  • Git: For cloning the repository

Optional Dependencies

These components are optional but enable full theme management features:

  • Hyprland: For desktop environment features
  • Waybar: For status bar theming
  • Kitty: For terminal theming
  • Rofi/Fuzzel: For launcher theming
  • Mako: For notification theming
  • Alacritty: Alternative terminal theming

docs.title: Installation Methods
docs.text:
Build from SourcePre-built BinaryGo Install

Recommended for developers

Building from source ensures you have the latest code and can customize the build.

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/rebelopsio/gohan.git
cd gohan

# Build the binary
go build -o gohan ./cmd/gohan

# Optional: Install system-wide
sudo cp gohan /usr/local/bin/

# Verify installation
gohan version

Quick installation

Download and install a pre-compiled binary in seconds.

# Download latest release
wget https://github.com/rebelopsio/gohan/releases/latest/download/gohan-linux-amd64

# Make executable
chmod +x gohan-linux-amd64
sudo mv gohan-linux-amd64 /usr/local/bin/gohan

# Verify installation
gohan version

For Go developers

Install directly using Go's package manager.

# Install directly with go install
go install github.com/rebelopsio/gohan/cmd/gohan@latest

# Verify installation
gohan version

docs.title: 1. Initialize Configuration
docs.text:
Automatic Configuration

Gohan creates its configuration directory automatically on first run.

# Initialize (happens automatically on first command)
gohan theme list

# Configuration location:
# ~/.config/gohan/

docs.title: 2. Verify Installation
docs.text:
Preflight Checks

Run preflight checks to ensure your system is ready:

# Check system requirements
gohan preflight check

This will verify:

  • Operating system compatibility
  • Required packages
  • File permissions
  • Hyprland installation (if applicable)

docs.title: 3. Initial Theme Setup
docs.text:
First Theme

Set your first theme to initialize the theme system:

# List available themes
gohan theme list

# Apply a theme
gohan theme set mocha

# Verify theme was applied
gohan theme show

docs.title: Directory Structure
docs.text:
After installation, Gohan uses these directories:

~/.config/gohan/
├── theme-state.json          # Current theme state
├── theme-history.json         # Theme change history
└── backups/                   # Configuration backups
    └── <timestamp>/          # Timestamped backup directories

# System configurations (created by theme application)
~/.config/
├── hypr/hyprland.conf        # Hyprland config
├── waybar/style.css          # Waybar styling
├── kitty/kitty.conf          # Kitty terminal
├── rofi/config.rasi          # Rofi launcher
├── mako/config               # Mako notifications
├── alacritty/alacritty.toml  # Alacritty terminal
└── fuzzel/fuzzel.ini         # Fuzzel launcher

docs.title: Remove Gohan Binary
docs.text:
# Remove system-wide installation
sudo rm /usr/local/bin/gohan

# Or remove from Go bin
rm ~/go/bin/gohan

docs.title: Remove Configuration (Optional)
docs.text:
# Remove Gohan configuration directory
rm -rf ~/.config/gohan

# Note: This removes:
# - Theme state and history
# - All configuration backups

docs.title: Restore Original Configurations
docs.text:
# Gohan creates backups before modifying files
# To restore from a backup:
gohan config rollback <backup-id>

# Or manually restore from backup directory
cp ~/.config/gohan/backups/<timestamp>/hyprland.conf ~/.config/hypr/hyprland.conf

docs.title: Troubleshooting Installation
docs.text:
Common Issues

Here are solutions to common installation problems.

command not found: gohan

Problem: Gohan binary not in PATH

Solution: 

# If installed to /usr/local/bin, ensure it's in PATH
echo $PATH | grep /usr/local/bin

# If not, add to ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc:
export PATH="/usr/local/bin:$PATH"
source ~/.bashrc  # or ~/.zshrc

permission denied

Problem: Binary not executable

Solution: 

chmod +x /path/to/gohan

Build fails with Go errors

Problem: Go version too old

Solution: 

# Check Go version
go version

# Should be 1.21 or higher
# Install newer Go from https://go.dev/dl/

Missing dependencies

Problem: Template system requires certain packages

Solution: 

# Install required development tools
sudo apt-get update
sudo apt-get install build-essential git

# For full Hyprland support
gohan install hyprland-complete

docs.title: Basic Application
docs.text:
The simplest way to apply a theme:

gohan theme set <theme-name>

Example: 

$ gohan theme set latte
Applying theme 'latte'...

✓ Successfully applied theme 'Catppuccin Latte'

Theme applied successfully!
Updated configuration files:
  - Hyprland configuration
  - Waybar configuration
  - Kitty terminal colors
  - Rofi/Fuzzel theme
  - Mako notifications
  - Alacritty terminal
  - Fuzzel launcher

Backups have been created. Use 'gohan theme rollback' to restore previous theme.

docs.title: What Happens When You Apply a Theme?
docs.text:
1. Backup Creation: Current configurations are backed up
  2. Template Processing: Theme templates are processed with new colors
  3. File Deployment: New configurations are deployed atomically
  4. Component Reload: Hyprland and Waybar automatically reload
  5. State Saving: Theme state is persisted to disk
  6. History Recording: Theme change is added to history

docs.title: Auto-Reload Feature
docs.text: When you apply a theme, Gohan automatically: - Reloads Hyprland: Uses hyprctl reload to apply new config - Restarts Waybar: Kills and restarts Waybar with new theme - No Manual Intervention: Everything happens seamlessly

docs.title: Rollback to Previous Theme
docs.text:
Undo your last theme change:

gohan theme rollback

Example: 

$ gohan theme rollback
Rolling back to previous theme...

✓ Successfully rolled back from 'latte' to 'mocha'

Theme rolled back successfully!
Restored theme: mocha
Previous theme: latte

Configuration files have been updated.
Use 'gohan theme rollback' again to continue rolling back through history.

docs.title: Sequential Rollbacks
docs.text:
You can rollback multiple times to step through your theme history:

# Apply several themes
gohan theme set mocha
gohan theme set latte
gohan theme set frappe

# Roll back one by one
gohan theme rollback  # frappe -> latte
gohan theme rollback  # latte -> mocha
gohan theme rollback  # mocha -> (previous theme)

docs.title: History Limits
docs.text:
• Gohan maintains up to 10 theme changes in history
  • Oldest entries are automatically removed
  • History persists across restarts
  • History is stored in ~/.config/gohan/theme-history.json

docs.title: Error Handling
docs.text:
If no history is available:

$ gohan theme rollback

✗ No theme history available
You need to change themes at least once before you can rollback.

  green:     #a6e3a1

docs.title: Component Support
docs.text: Gohan applies themes to all supported components automatically:

docs.title: Hyprland
docs.text:
• Window borders and shadows
  • Workspace colors
  • General UI elements

docs.title: Waybar
docs.text:
• Bar background and text
  • Module colors
  • Hover states

docs.title: Kitty Terminal
docs.text:
• Background and foreground
  • Cursor colors
  • 16-color palette
  • Bold/italic variants

docs.title: Rofi Launcher
docs.text:
• Window background
  • Text and selection colors
  • Border styling

docs.title: Mako Notifications
docs.text:
• Background and text
  • Urgency levels (low/normal/high)
  • Border colors
  • Progress bar

docs.title: Alacritty Terminal
docs.text:
• Complete color scheme
  • Normal and bright colors
  • Cursor styling

docs.title: Fuzzel Launcher
docs.text:
• Background and text
  • Match highlighting
  • Selection colors
  • Border styling

docs.title: Template Locations
docs.text:
Theme templates are located in: 

templates/
├── hyprland/hyprland.conf.tmpl
├── waybar/style.css.tmpl
├── kitty/kitty.conf.tmpl
├── rofi/config.rasi.tmpl
├── mako/config.tmpl
├── alacritty/alacritty.toml.tmpl
└── fuzzel/fuzzel.ini.tmpl

docs.title: Available Template Variables
docs.text:
All templates have access to theme color variables:

{{.theme_name}}          - Theme identifier
{{.theme_display_name}}  - Human-readable name
{{.theme_variant}}       - "dark" or "light"

{{.theme_base}}          - Background color
{{.theme_surface}}       - Surface color
{{.theme_overlay}}       - Overlay color
{{.theme_text}}          - Primary text
{{.theme_subtext}}       - Secondary text

{{.theme_rosewater}}     - Rosewater accent
{{.theme_flamingo}}      - Flamingo accent
{{.theme_pink}}          - Pink accent
{{.theme_mauve}}         - Mauve accent
{{.theme_red}}           - Red accent
{{.theme_maroon}}        - Maroon accent
{{.theme_peach}}         - Peach accent
{{.theme_yellow}}        - Yellow accent
{{.theme_green}}         - Green accent
{{.theme_teal}}          - Teal accent
{{.theme_sky}}           - Sky accent
{{.theme_sapphire}}      - Sapphire accent
{{.theme_blue}}          - Blue accent
{{.theme_lavender}}      - Lavender accent

docs.title: Creating Custom Templates
docs.text:
You can customize templates to match your preferences:

  1. Copy the template: 

    cp templates/waybar/style.css.tmpl templates/waybar/style.css.tmpl.custom

  2. Edit with theme variables: 

    /* Custom Waybar styling */
window#waybar {
    background-color: {{.theme_base}};
    color: {{.theme_text}};
    border-top: 2px solid {{.theme_mauve}};
}

#workspaces button.active {
    background-color: {{.theme_blue}};
    color: {{.theme_base}};
}

  3. Apply your custom template: 

    gohan config deploy --template templates/waybar/style.css.tmpl.custom \
    --target ~/.config/waybar/style.css

docs.title: Persistence
docs.text:
Theme state is automatically persisted to disk:

# State location
~/.config/gohan/theme-state.json

# Example content:
{
  "theme_name": "mocha",
  "theme_variant": "dark",
  "set_at": "2025-10-28T15:30:00Z"
}

Theme settings persist across: - Terminal restarts - System reboots - Gohan updates

docs.title: Theme doesn't apply to all components
docs.text:
Problem: Some components still show old theme

Solution: 

# Manually reload components
hyprctl reload
killall waybar && waybar &

docs.title: Colors look wrong
docs.text:
Problem: Terminal doesn't support true color

Solution: 

# Check terminal color support
echo $COLORTERM  # Should output "truecolor" or "24bit"

# For Kitty/Alacritty, this should work automatically
# For other terminals, enable true color support

docs.title: Rollback doesn't work
docs.text:
Problem: "No theme history available"

Solution: - History only tracks theme changes made with gohan theme set - Apply at least one theme to build history - Check ~/.config/gohan/theme-history.json exists

docs.title: Best Practices
docs.text:
1. Preview Before Applying: Use gohan theme preview to see colors first
  2. Backup Important Configs: While Gohan creates backups, maintain your own
  3. Use Rollback: Don't hesitate to rollback if you don't like a theme
  4. Customize Templates: Make themes your own with custom templates
  5. Check Component Support: Ensure your components are supported

docs.title: Troubleshooting Guide
docs.text: This guide covers common issues and their solutions when using Gohan.

docs.title: Table of Contents
docs.text:
• Installation Issues
  • Theme Issues

  • Component Reload Issues
  • General Issues

docs.title: "command not found: gohan"
docs.text:
Symptoms: Running gohan returns "command not found"

Cause: Gohan binary is not in your PATH

Solutions:

  1. Check installation location: 

    which gohan
# If no output, gohan is not in PATH

  2. Add to PATH (if installed to custom location): 

    # Add to ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc
export PATH="/path/to/gohan:$PATH"
source ~/.bashrc  # or ~/.zshrc

  3. Install system-wide: 

    sudo cp gohan /usr/local/bin/

docs.title: "permission denied" when running gohan
docs.text:
Symptoms: bash: ./gohan: Permission denied

Cause: Binary is not executable

Solution: 

chmod +x gohan

docs.title: Build fails with Go errors
docs.text:
Symptoms: go build fails with compilation errors

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Go version too old: 

    # Check version
go version
# Should be 1.21 or higher

# Upgrade Go from https://go.dev/dl/

  2. Missing dependencies: 

    # Download dependencies
go mod download

# Tidy dependencies
go mod tidy

  3. Build cache issues: 

    # Clean build cache
go clean -cache -modcache

# Rebuild
go build -o gohan ./cmd/gohan

docs.title: Theme doesn't apply to all components
docs.text:
Symptoms: After applying a theme, some components still show old colors

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Component not running: 

    # Check if Waybar is running
pgrep waybar

# Start if not running
waybar &

  2. Manual reload needed: 

    # Reload Hyprland
hyprctl reload

# Restart Waybar
killall waybar && waybar &

# Restart Kitty (open new terminal)

  3. Configuration file not updated: 

    # Check if config file was modified
ls -la ~/.config/waybar/style.css

# View recent modifications
stat ~/.config/waybar/style.css

docs.title: Colors look wrong or washed out
docs.text:
Symptoms: Theme colors appear incorrect or faded

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Terminal doesn't support true color: 

    # Check color support
echo $COLORTERM
# Should output "truecolor" or "24bit"

# For Kitty
export COLORTERM=truecolor

# Add to ~/.bashrc or ~/.zshrc

  2. Old configuration cached: 

    # Clear Kitty cache
rm -rf ~/.cache/kitty

# Restart Kitty

docs.title: "Theme not found" error
docs.text:
Symptoms: gohan theme set xyz returns "theme not found"

Cause: Invalid theme name

Solution: 

# List available themes
gohan theme list

# Use exact theme name
gohan theme set mocha

docs.title: Theme rollback doesn't work
docs.text:
Symptoms: "No theme history available" when trying to rollback

Causes & Solutions:

  1. No theme changes made: 

    # Apply a theme first
gohan theme set mocha
gohan theme set latte

# Now rollback works
gohan theme rollback

  2. History file corrupted: 

    # Check history file
cat ~/.config/gohan/theme-history.json

# If corrupted, remove and rebuild
rm ~/.config/gohan/theme-history.json
gohan theme set mocha  # Starts fresh history

  3. Only one theme in history:

  4. Rollback requires at least 2 themes in history
  5. Apply another theme to build history

docs.title: Configuration file not created
docs.text:
Symptoms: Template deployed but target file doesn't exist

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Directory doesn't exist: 

    # Create target directory
mkdir -p ~/.config/waybar

# Reapply theme
gohan theme set mocha

  2. Permission issues: 

    # Check directory permissions
ls -la ~/.config/

# Fix permissions
chmod 755 ~/.config/waybar

docs.title: Backup creation fails
docs.text:
Symptoms: Warning about backup failure when applying theme

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Backup directory doesn't exist: 

    # Create backup directory
mkdir -p ~/.config/gohan/backups

# Set permissions
chmod 755 ~/.config/gohan/backups

  2. Disk space full: 

    # Check disk space
df -h

# Clean old backups if needed
rm -rf ~/.config/gohan/backups/old-*

docs.title: Template variables not replaced
docs.text:
Symptoms: Config files contain {{.theme_base}} instead of actual colors

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Template syntax error: 

    # Check template file for syntax errors
# Variables must be: {{.variable_name}}
# Not: {{ .variable_name }} (extra spaces)

  2. Missing template file: 

    # Check template exists
ls -la templates/waybar/style.css.tmpl

# If missing, template can't be processed

docs.title: Hyprland doesn't reload after theme change
docs.text:
Symptoms: Hyprland still shows old theme after applying new theme

Causes & Solutions:

  1. hyprctl not available: 

    # Check if hyprctl is installed
which hyprctl

# If not installed, Hyprland may not be running
# or not in PATH

  2. Manual reload needed: 

    # Reload Hyprland manually
hyprctl reload

# Or restart Hyprland session

docs.title: Waybar doesn't restart
docs.text:
Symptoms: Waybar still shows old theme

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Waybar not running: 

    # Check if running
pgrep waybar

# Start Waybar
waybar &

  2. Waybar crashes on restart: 

    # Check Waybar logs
journalctl --user -u waybar

# Or run Waybar in foreground to see errors
killall waybar
waybar

  3. Configuration syntax error: 

    # Validate Waybar config
waybar --config ~/.config/waybar/config \
       --style ~/.config/waybar/style.css

# Fix any syntax errors reported

docs.title: "failed to reload Hyprland" warning
docs.text:
Symptoms: Warning message when applying theme

Cause: hyprctl command failed

Solutions:

  1. Hyprland not running:
  2. This is expected if not using Hyprland

  3. Warning can be safely ignored

  4. Permission issues: 

    # Check Hyprland socket permissions
ls -la /tmp/hypr/

docs.title: State file corruption
docs.text:
Symptoms: Errors reading theme state, inconsistent behavior

Solution: 

# Remove corrupt state files
rm ~/.config/gohan/theme-state.json
rm ~/.config/gohan/theme-history.json

# Reapply theme to rebuild state
gohan theme set mocha

docs.title: Slow theme application
docs.text:
Symptoms: Theme takes a long time to apply

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Large number of backups: 

    # Check backup directory size
du -sh ~/.config/gohan/backups

# Clean old backups
find ~/.config/gohan/backups -type d -mtime +30 -exec rm -rf {} +

  2. Slow template processing:

  3. Usually fast, but complex templates may take longer
  4. Consider simplifying custom templates

docs.title: Configuration not persisting across reboots
docs.text:
Symptoms: Theme resets after system restart

Causes & Solutions:

  1. State file not readable: 

    # Check file exists and is readable
cat ~/.config/gohan/theme-state.json

# If missing or unreadable, reapply theme
gohan theme set mocha

  2. Components reset their configs:

  3. Some components may override configs on startup
  4. Check component-specific startup configs

docs.title: "Failed to deploy configurations" error
docs.text:
Symptoms: Theme application fails with deployment error

Causes & Solutions:

  1. Template not found: 

    # Check templates exist
ls -la templates/

# Reinstall Gohan if templates are missing

  2. Target directory permissions: 

    # Check ~/.config permissions
ls -la ~/.config

# Fix permissions
chmod 755 ~/.config
chmod 755 ~/.config/hypr ~/.config/waybar

  3. Disk space full: 

    # Check disk space
df -h

docs.title: Getting Help
docs.text:
If you've tried the solutions above and still have issues:

  1. Check GitHub Issues: https://github.com/rebelopsio/gohan/issues
  2. Search existing issues

  3. Someone may have encountered the same problem

  4. Enable Verbose Output: 

    gohan --verbose theme set mocha

  5. Collect Debug Information: 

    # System information
uname -a
go version
gohan version

# Component versions
hyprctl version
waybar --version
kitty --version

# File permissions
ls -la ~/.config/gohan
ls -la ~/.config/hypr
ls -la ~/.config/waybar

# Recent logs
journalctl --user -n 50

  6. Create an Issue:

  7. Include the debug information above
  8. Describe what you were trying to do
  9. Include exact error messages

  10. Mention your OS and versions

  11. Join Discussions: https://github.com/rebelopsio/gohan/discussions

  12. Ask questions
  13. Share experiences
  14. Get community help

docs.title: Prevention Tips
docs.text:
1. Keep Backups: Gohan creates backups, but maintain your own for important configs
  2. Test Changes: Use gohan theme preview before applying
  3. Update Regularly: Keep Gohan updated for bug fixes
  4. Read Logs: Check logs when things go wrong
  5. Use Rollback: Don't hesitate to rollback if something breaks
